6.4mm DynamicDrivers
Works withAndroid & iOS



 

Super LightweightDesign
MetalBuild

The Final E3000 is my favourite from the Final lineup. There's a reason that the E3000 has been voted best beginner IEM for six years in a row. The shiny metal earbuds are built like a tank. And its versatile balanced sound signature has a lot more bass than the E1000 and E2000.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru 

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.

DESCRIPTION


THE PINNACLE OF CUTTING-EDGE JAPANESE ENGINEERING


Final makes use of high precision Japanese engineering with focus on finesse and accuracy. Adopting cutting edge technology with high attention to detail and the highest quality of audio design, Final has carved a name for itself amongst audiophiles winning multiple awards over the years.      CREATING VALUABLE ANTIQUES, NOT JUST PRODUCTS


The team at Final strongly believes in creating earphones and headphones that are highly revered by people. Final earphones, like Swiss wristwatches and German Cars must be built to last forever and used as valuable antiques. The result of such careful consideration is a long-lasting, rational & emotionally valuable asset with the best sound quality and best design.



CRAFTED IN KAWASAKI, JAPAN SINCE 1974


At the Final factory, the team of audio designers are dedicated to innovating audio products through research. Unlike other OEM manufacturers, they believe in designing their products in-house. This facilitates internal feedback between various teams and departments, encouraging the process for developing a long lasting product.



A PROUD SHOWCASE OF JAPANESE HERITAGE AND CRAFTSMANSHIP


Final has a state-of-the-art company-owned “Final Store” located in Tokyo, Japan. This is open to all music lovers and audio enthusiasts to come in and experience Final’s range of headphones & earphones. The store proudly showcases their Japanese heritage and cultural artefacts. This represents Final's deep respect for the audio purist.
6.4MMφ DYNAMIC DRIVER UNIT DELIVER AWARD WINNING PERFORMANCE


Final E3000 and E3000C features a powerful yet small-aperture 6.4mm diameter dynamic driver that has been precisely assembled to deliver pristine audio quality. The precision involved in the assembling process for the driver unit is given the utmost importance. With this dynamic driver, you experience clear audio with all the frequency ranges tuned to deliver a flat sound without any masking. The Final E3000 and E3000C are tuned incorporating the latest in acoustic engineering and psychoacoustics technology gained through the team's research and development efforts. With the combination of the technology embedded in these earphones, they surpass many earphones and have been awarded the Gold Prize at the VGP 2019 SUMMER awards in Japan.UNIQUE SWING-FITTING EARPIECE MECHANISM FOR COMFORT & FLEXIBILITY


The Final E3000 and E3000C have been designed to provide the utmost comfort and durability. Featuring a unique swing-fit mechanism allowing the earpiece to be able to move left and right and tilt towards the audio canal for a perfect fit. These prevent changes in shape owing to the aperture of the earpiece coming into contact with the auditory canal. The sound is transmitted directly to the eardrum, delivering clear sound.

DURABLE STAINLESS STEEL HOUSING FUSED WITH STAINLESS STEEL MESH BACK


The Final E3000 and E3000C are made with premium materials and utmost precision. The housing for the earpiece is made out of highly rigid stainless steel with a mirror finish to support the driver unit and suppress any unnecessary vibrations. This design and selected materials are contributing elements concerning sound quality. This is a design that has a simple shape and a high-quality texture matched with classic sound quality. The back of the housing features an aperture that acts to extend low-frequency reproduction while enhancing isolation. The aperture is made of stainless steel material and features a filter inside to prevent sound leakage.



E3000C EMBEDDED WITH MICROPHONE AND IN-LINE CONTROLS


The included cable with the Final E3000C features a quality microphone to receive calls and for communication. This microphone is a high-quality mic capable of transmitting clean audio. There are quick-access functions assigned to the button on the microphone housing and it allows for receiving calls, rejecting calls, playing/pausing music and changing the songs played. This is truly useful as you don’t need to access your devices to execute these frequently used functions.

ENGINEERED TO SOUND STUNNING WITH REGULAR USE


The Final E3000 and E3000C come embedded with driver units with a diaphragm attached to a voice coil and adhesive agent. With audio signals flowing, the diaphragm moves in minute increments along with the voice coil allowing the sound to be produced. Over time, the diaphragm moves efficiently and the sound changes or ‘ages’. The E3000 and E3000C have a small aperture, and so an extended period is necessary for changes through ageing to become noticeable. When used for over 150-200 hours, it should feel as though the sound has become stable. Favourable outcomes can be obtained through the ageing of the product, by listening to the music you normally listen to at a volume you usually listen to.



HIGH-QUALITY OFC CABLE CAPABLE OF SUPPRESSING TOUCH NOISE


Final E3000 and E3000C employ a thick and flexible cable to prevent breakage and tangling whilst using the earphones. The cable is made of rubber and coated to extend its life. E3000 and E3000C use a more flexible OFC (oxygen-free copper) cable to transmit better audio signals from a device to the earbuds. This design drastically suppresses touch noise when the connecting cable touches the body. The earphones feature a Y split point and an L-shaped jack to further solidify the durability. This durable cable and connector make connecting to a source device easy and seamless.



BUNDLED WITH HIGH-QUALITY EAR HOOKS FOR A COMFORTABLE WEARING EXPERIENCE


The E3000 and E3000C come bundled with premium quality ear hooks that are crafted to fit everyone. The team at Final considered the key aspects to designing an ear hook that was comfortable to wear and discovered a form that was smaller than most existing ear hooks and that didn't utilise metal or resin wires. This decision allowed for a slimmer ear hook and one that feels premium to the touch, allowing the user to wear the earphones for extended periods and enjoy their music. 5 INTERCHANGEABLE EAR-TIPS AND CARRY POUCH INCLUDED FOR ALL USERS


The ear tips for the Final E3000 and E3000C have been designed from soft silicone for superior comfort and noise isolation. These come in 5 sizes and ensure that the sound is transmitted directly to the eardrum. Two types of silicon differing in rigidity are employed for the sound conduit and for the earbud that comes into contact with the user’s ear. The silicon used for the sound conduit is more rigid than that used for the earbud, and having groove processing applied to it, combines both strength and flexibility. These earphones also come bundled with a carry case making them perfect to carry along with you.

DESCRIPTION


EQUIPPED WITH ELECTROSTATIC DRIVER TO DELIVER CRISP AUDIO


KZ x Crinacle CRN is the latest hybrid configuration IEM made in collaboration with Crinacle featuring the latest innovation in driver technology. Meticulously engineered, designed and tuned to deliver outstanding performance in terms of audio reproduction. To achieve this, the team at KZ employs a cutting edge low voltage electrostatic driver in the CRN. Designed to house a driver utilising electret driver technology, this delivers consistent and crisp sound. Utilising this technology, the CRN can offer high-quality sound and clarity while reducing distortion levels to a minimum.
COLLECTIVELY DEVELOPED HIGH-PERFORMANCE HYBRID DRIVER SETUP


The KZ x Crinacle CRN features a jointly developed high-performance hybrid driver setup with Crinacle. Encasing a 6.8mm electrostatic driver, one 10mm dual magnetic circuit dynamic driver and one 30095 high frequency balanced armature driver - that delivers a balanced sound. The low-voltage electrostatic driver is far more stable and superior than the previous generation and the three types of drivers are fully integrated and supplemented by precise tuning by Crinacle that instantly and accurately reproduce sounds from 20Hz to 40kHz, allowing you to enjoy your music with utmost clarity.



HIGH-QUALITY BUILD AND ERGONOMIC DESIGN FOR A SNUG FIT


The KZ x Crinacle CRN in-ears showcases high-quality materials and expert level craftsmanship. The materials used to design the housing are of high quality making it durable and sturdy. The faceplates are made of aviation-grade zinc alloy with laser radium engraving is matched with a medical-grade skin-friendly resin shell. A perfect combination of delicate metal texturing and streamlined beauty. Premium quality materials are utilised to design the casing of the CRN, allowing for a snug fit, effectively isolating external noise by 26dB. The overall design reflects the extraordinary quality and feels like a premium product. The CRN also features Crinacle’s logo engraved on the earpieces making it distinct and elevating the look of the in-ears.



BUNDLED WITH A DETACHABLE CABLE WITH A 2PIN CONNECTOR


A high-quality double flat silver-plated cable comes bundled with the CRN. This included cable enhances audio performance and reduces the loss of audio signal during transmission. The new double line silver cable has a lower impedance and features a sturdy design that has been stress tested over 50,000+ times. These cables feature a 2Pin connector on one end and a 3.5mm connector on the other, allowing for easy connectivity with various devices and even allowing for upgradability. The connector plugs are gold platted reducing distortion and allowing for cleaner audio transmission.



FAST BURN-IN TIME AND HD MICROPHONE WITH INLINE CONTROLS


The newly developed KZ x Crinacle CRN features a low-voltage electrostatic driver which is engineered in a manner that just listening to music for 5 minutes is enough to stimulate the potential of the IEM. This fast burn-in time is truly unheard of and only a little current is needed to show strong performance potential. The included cable with the KZ x Crinacle CRN features a high-quality condenser microphone for communication. There are quick-access functions assigned to the button in the microphone housing and it allows for receiving calls, rejecting calls, playing/pausing music and changing the songs played.

Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! UPGRADED 3 TUNING ACOUSTICS FOR A RICH, VIVID AND DETAILED SOUND

DETAILING DOWN TO THE (ZS)T


Details can either make it or mess it. The ZST X focuses on every detail. From the HD microphone to the patented soft silicone sleeve and the L/R mark on the earbuds, the ZST X offers great details and a slick design. headPhone.title: HiFiMAN - Edition XS
headPhone.product_description:
Chi-Fi Excellence
Balanced Sound Signature
1 Year ofWarranty
Ideal forAudiophiles
Ideal forIndoor Use
Open-BackDesign
Planar MagneticDrivers
Replaceable Cables



DESCRIPTION


HIFIMAN INTRODUCES THE NEW EDITION XS FULL-SIZED PLANAR MAGNETIC HEADPHONES


Meet the all-new Edition XS planar magnetic headphones from Hifiman. Coming as a successor to the award-winning Hifiman Edition X, the latest Edition XS features all-new Neo Super-Nano Diaphragm and Stealth magnet technology. Hifiman Edition XS has been tuned by professionals to deliver a natural and vivid sound reproduction. Edition XS presents you with a surround sound feeling. It leaves you in awe with deep-hitting bass response, lush vocals, energetic treble and a wide 3D soundstage. Enjoy your favourite music with the outstanding Hifiman Edition XS.

PLANAR MAGNETIC DRIVERS FUSED WITH NEO DIAPHRAGM AND STEALTH MAGNET TECH


Hifiman has mastery in designing and developing full-sized planar magnetic headphones. The latest Edition XS uses a newly developed planar magnetic driver with an ultra-thin diaphragm coil known as Neo super-nano diaphragm. This driver has an impressively fast response resulting in a highly-detailed sound with lower distortion. This new driver works in conjunction with invisible Stealth Magnets, which enables the sound waves to pass through the magnets without generating interference. Hifiman’s advanced magnet design is acoustically transparent, dramatically reducing wave diffraction turbulence that degrades the integrity of the sound waves. The reduced distortion yields pure sonic output that is accurate and full-range.


THE STEALTH MAGNET DESIGN OFFERS LOW IMPEDANCE AND WIDE FREQUENCY RESPONSE


Hifiman developed the stealth magnet design for their flagship Susvara and has featured the same technology with the latest Edition XS. For this, Hifiman has optimised the air turbulence and reflection of the sound waves inside the driver cavity. This design makes the magnet invisible in front of the sound waves and results in refined audio performance. Aside from improved acoustic performance, the Edition XS has a low impedance of 18Ω, which allows it to be easily driven. The new acoustic architecture also offers a frequency response from 8Hz-50kHz, allowing you to enjoy your music in full fidelity.REDESIGNED WITH NEW HEADBAND AND 3.5MM SOCKETS TO OFFER BETTER COMFORT


Hifiman has designed a new headband for the Edition XS. This headband is familiar to their recently launched HE400i headphones and offers better comfort and durability. The new headband is lightweight, ergonomically structured to offer maximum comfort for hours of listening pleasure. The exterior is refined matte black material, and the interior features high-grade memory foam for the most comfortable fit and elasticity. The headphone’s structural design supports overall durability that retains its comfortable fit for years of enjoyment. The Edition XS also features new 3.5mm sockets for connectivity which are similar to those found on most common audio devices. The included 3.5mm cable is user changeable and replaceable.

8Hz-50kHz

What is the warranty period on the HiFiMAN Edition XS and how do I claim it?

All HiFiMAN products come with 1 year of warranty. To claim warranty read more on HiFiMAN warranty here. We are very helpful guys, just saying.

Which drivers are used in HiFiMAN Edition XS?

The HiFiMAN Edition XS is loaded with Planar magnetic drivers that delivers an excellent audiophile sound.

Does the HiFiMAN Edition XS come with detachable cables?

Yes, the cables are indeed detachable. Making for easy storage and convenient for whenever you want to replace or upgrade cables.

Can I use the HiFiMAN Edition XS for long hours?

The HiFiMAN Edition XS is made of lightweight that allows you to use them for long hours without experiencing fatigue. The soft leather headband and over-ear design with memory foam earpads also helps in the same.

Does the HiFiMAN Edition XS come with mic?

No, the HiFiMAN Edition XS does not come with a microphone.

What do “Impedance” and “Ohms” mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω.

Designed in  Romania

DESCRIPTION


A BENCHMARK REFERENCE HEADPHONE TRUSTED BY PROFESSIONALS FOR OVER 20+ YEARS


An embodiment of Sennheiser's passion for perfect sound, the Sennheiser HD 600 is designed for analytical listening and is ideal for reference playback. Even after 20+ years of its release, the Sennheiser HD 600 remains highly popular and a go-to headphone for professionals. Engineered for an impartial understanding of sound, the Sennheiser HD 600 is dedicated to audio professionals and audiophiles.
PERFECTLY FUSING THE ART OF SOUND WITH THE SCIENCE OF SOUND


The standard benchmark reference headphone, the HD 600 is perfect for critical listening, mixing & mastering. Developed through an innovative and systematic approach to sound reproduction, transparency is the core principle of the Sennheiser HD 600. These reference headphones are an amalgamation of Sennheiser's latest production techniques and computer-based transducer optimization.EXCELLENTLY ENGINEERED FOR THE MOST NATURAL MUSIC LISTENING EXPERIENCE


The transducer system of the Sennheiser HD 600 is empowered by transparent open-back earcups that allow the soundwaves to expand freely. Use of a mighty 42mm driver and airflow-controlling acoustic silk, the HD 600 propels turbulence and distortion-free sound. The ultralight aluminium voice coils employed in the HD 600 allows the 38mm diaphragm to offer quick and accurate response times. This also ensures that the music you listen to on these headphones are detailed without sounding harsh or hyped.
DETAILED AND NUANCED MASTERING-GRADE SOUND FOR AN INCREDIBLE SONIC EXPERIENCE


With a 300-ohm impedance of the Sennheiser HD 600 represents details and nuances of sound that you never knew existed. Tested against rigid performance standards, the HD 600 delivers excellent performance across audio frequencies, eliminates discrepancies among the right and left channels while reproducing mastering-grade sound.
ASSEMBLED IN ROMANIA OFFERING PROFESSIONAL-GRADE LUXURY, COMFORT AND DURABILITY


Padded with supple velour, the Sennheiser HD 600 is meant for extended hours of music listening. The grilled pattern on the earcup strengthens the transducer system to deliver a real personal listening experience. Assembled at a state-of-the-art production facility in Romania, the HD 600 is made with precision and attention to detail. This is also a reason for the HD 600 being a go-to reference headphone for professionals around the world.


AVAILABLE WITH A WIDE RANGE OF CONNECTIVITY OPTIONS


Paired with a detachable and impedance-matched cable, the Sennheiser HD 600 offers ultra-low capacitance. These cables come with an audiophile-grade ¼-inch / 6.3mm stereo connector that can be used with headphone amplifiers, A/V receivers, digital audio players and more. With 9.8 feet / 3m long cables, you can move around freely while the premium 6.3mm to 3.5mm / ⅛-inch adapter allows you to connect the Sennheiser HD 600 to countless other audio devices.

Are the cables on Sennheiser HD 600 tangle free?

Yes, the Sennheiser HD 600 comes with single-sided cable tangle free cables, One less thing to worry about.

Do I require an amp to drive the Sennheiser HD 600?

Yes, to bring the best of these headphones an Amp is recommended. You could have a look at our collection of portable Amps here and desktop Amps here.

What is the impedance on the Sennheiser HD 600?

The Sennheiser HD 600 comes with the impedance of 300Ω.

What do “Impedance” and “Ohms” mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω.

 These were my first pair of serious Headphones. I would listen to every genre track on them. It's gorgeous to look at, and sounds better than anything else in the segment. They're timeliness. I hope to hand them to my kids someday.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru 

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.
DESCRIPTION


A HEADPHONE AS UNIQUE AND AWESOME AS YOU!


Experience pure luxury in terms of looks and sound with the Meze 99 Classics. This headphone has been lovingly handcrafted from wood and the satin-finished wood grain makes each headphone unique, just like your fingerprint. With these, Meze has worked to change the perception of headphones from being seen as technical devices or cheap plastic accessories to a mature product that you'll fall in love with.
 
A RICH NATURAL SOUND


Enjoy a crisp, balanced sound with the Meze 99 Classics. The 40mm neodymium drivers offer a clear, undistorted sound. Just sit back and put these on to enjoy the gorgeous sound of plucked strings, upbeat grooves or thumping beats that's natural and lifelike. In addition, the snug medium density memory foam keeps away noise while offering superior noise isolation.
HIGH-QUALITY AND LUXURY IN EVERY ELEMENT


Apart from wood, the 99 Classics also use cast zinc and manganese spring steel. The headband ensures even pressure for long listening sessions. The headpad and earpads are made from PU leather. Everything is then put together using nuts and bolts. This makes the headphone fully serviceable. The entire headphone is made from only premium materials, no glue or plastic.
MADE WITH CARE USING AN EXTENSIVE PROCESS


Each Meze 99 Classics takes almost 45 days to be made. The wood used is harvested from mature trees that have reached the end of their life cycle. This ensures that there is no harm done to the environment while giving you that rich, natural sound. To further enhance the colours, the wood goes through extensive air drying and shaping by hand and CNC machines, a process that takes almost 8 hours. It then goes through sanding, lacquering, finishing, careful inspection and is finally assembled.

DESCRIPTION


GET YOUR HANDS ON AUDIO-TECHNICA’S FIRST PROFESSIONAL OPEN-BACK HEADPHONE


The Audio Technica ATH-R70x is the first pair of open-back reference professional headphones and stands as a flagship model in A-T’s lineup of professional studio headphones from Audio Technica. ATH-R70x features specially designed proprietary 45mm large-aperture drivers and acoustically transparent housings fashioned from aluminium honeycomb mesh. These headphones provide an accurate and natural open-back sound. They also incorporate a new, improved design of the popular 3D wing support system to provide even greater comfort during the prolonged use often required in a professional setting.
PROPRIETARY DRIVERS FUSED IN AN OPEN-BACK DESIGN FOR AUDIO PROFESSIONALS


Accuracy and clarity are apexes when it comes to sound quality. Audio-Technica ATH-R70x professional open-back headphones deliver just that and bring out all the detail in your music and mixes. The ATH-R70x features proprietary 45mm large-aperture drivers tuned to accurately reproduce extreme low and high frequencies while maintaining perfect balance. High-efficiency magnets and pure alloy magnetic circuit design reduce distortion and ensure accurate and extended frequency response from 5-40,000 Hz. Combined with the open-back design and acoustically transparent aluminium honeycomb-mesh housings, these premium headphones are suited for studio mixing, personal listening, mastering, post-production and audio forensics.



 MASTERFULLY ENGINEERED AND DESIGNED FOR LONG LISTENING HOURS IN THE STUDIO


The Audio Technica ATH-R70x have been engineered with carbon composite resin that improves structural rigidity and delivers a detailed transient response never heard before. The Audio Technica ATH-R70x allows you to stay focused on your music with the exceptionally lightweight design and 3D Wing Support system to keep you comfortable during extended use. To elevate the wearing experience further, the ATH-R70x embodies breathable fabric on its earpads to provide superior comfort even during extended listening.


DETACHABLE CABLE DESIGN FOR STEREO ORIENTATION AND BUNDLED WITH ACCESSORIES


Audio Technica ATH-R70x are robust yet lightweight and equipped with a unique, dual-sided detachable cable that automatically maintains proper stereo orientation (no matter how it’s attached). Every aspect of the R70x headphones is designed for lasting comfort, convenience and audio purity. To get you started right out of the box, Audio Technica ATH-R70x comes bundled with a dual-sided straight cable for a tangle-free experience. You also get a protective carrying pouch to store your ATH-R70x headphone and carry it whoever you go.

BALANCED IN MORE WAYS THAN ONE: FROM SOUND TO DESIGN


Whether you’re mixing the next hit or want to listen to the audio as it is, the V-MODA M-200 delivers every detail. It offers a crystal-clear, neutral sound that picks-up even the subtle nuances of any track. The M-200 has been finely tuned by engineers at Roland to faithfully reproduce sound up to 40kHz. The 50mm drivers with neodymium magnets and CCAW voice coils ensure accurate audio reproduction. No wonder, it’s certified as Hi-Res Audio by the Japan Audio Society (JAS). V-MODA'S FIRST REFRENCE STUDIO HEADPHONES


The M-200 has been made for all-day usage. The broad headband design distributes the weight on the head evenly for added comfort. Large, detachable magnetic memory foam cushions, as well as the premium sweat-resistant PU leather exterior, ensure comfort all day long. The closed-back design keeps distractions away through its superior noise isolation while the flexible headband allows for single-ear monitoring.
 
HOST OF CABLE OPTIONS TO USE YOUR V-MODA TO THE FULLEST


The M-200 comes with two cables. The first is a single-sided balanced cable for critical listening and producing. It offers a lower signal‑to‑noise ratio for a more transparent, spacious sound. The second is the SpeakEasy™ 1-Button Mic Cable for music and taking calls when on-the-go. Apart from these, you can also separately purchase a variety of other options like: CoilPro Cable: Perfect for Producers, DJs and audio professionals for its extended listening reach. It comes with TwistLock technology. BoomPro Microphone: Perfect for gamers for crystal-clear communication. Speakeasy DAC/AMP Lightning Cable: Perfect for studio-quality sound from an iOS device (with lightning port). Audio Only Cable: Cable without remote for pure analogue sound.STRONG. FLEXIBLE. PORTABLE. COMFORTABLE.


Whether in the studio or on the road, the V-MODA M-200 is built to stay along all-through. The CliqFold hinge folds to be really tiny and can be easily slipped into the newly redesigned Exoskeleton case. The case offers more space for accessories as well as a carabiner clip to be attached to your backpack.

DESCRIPTION


EXPERIENCE THE TRUE SOUND OF MUSIC


If you are an audiophile you must be listening to music through a varied range of products like the headphone Amp's, computers and other audio devices. The Sennheiser HD 560s is designed to offer linear performance which allows audio enthusiasts to listen to their music in depth and detail.
OPEN EAR CUP DESIGN FOR NATURAL SOUND


The open ear cup design of the Sennheiser HD 560s allows for a free flow of sound waves. The driver unit is placed, keeping in mind E.A.R. (Ergonomic Acoustic Refinement) which sets up an optimal triangular listening position for hi-end sonic performance. It also leads to delivering a wide and clear soundstage for a natural and life-like music listening experience.CUSTOM-TUNED TRANSDUCERS FOR SIGNATURE SENNHEISER SOUND


Sennheiser HD 560S features custom-tuned transducers designed for accurate sound reproduction for reliable /B comparisons of components, mixes, and media formats. It delivers natural sound along with enhanced bass. The all-new and improved 120-ohm transducer has a polymer blend in the membrane designed for linear excursion and better performance of above 10 Hz. Owing to the drive magnet and the damping system, HD 560 S offers distortion-free deep bass output and fatigue-free music listening.
FOR WHERE THERE IS MUSIC THERE IS COMFORT


Inspired by the sound of HD 660S and the comfort of ultralight HD 599, the Sennheiser HD 560s features comfortable music listening experience. The velour pads are super soft on the ears, while the open around the ear design offer real sound and also keeps your ears cool without warming up.THE BEST OF CONNECTIVITY IS HERE


No matter which device you are using with the Sennheiser HD 560s, these headphones offer best-in-class connectivity. It comes with a 3-meter cable giving you enough space to reach your device while the 6.3mm / ¼-inch plug allows you to connect to headphone Amp's and other high-grade audio devices. It also has a flexible 3.5mm / ⅛-inch adapter for making the most out of portable music devices.

FAQs

What is the warranty period on the Sennheiser HD 560S?

All Sennheiser products come with a 2 year warranty. Read more on warranty claim here.

How does the Sennheiser HD 560S sound?

The HD 560S treats your ears to audiophile sound quality. With great clarity over the mids and the highs and it’s wide soundstage takes your music listening experience to a next level.

Does the Sennheiser HD 560S come with a mic?

No, the Sennheiser HD 560S does not come with a mic since it is more of a studio monitoring headphone.

Can I use the Sennheiser HD 560S for long hours?

The Sennheiser HD 560S is made of lightweight durable plastics that allows you to use them for long hours without experiencing fatigue. The soft leather headband and over-ear design with memory foam earpads also helps in the same.

Do I require an amp to drive the Sennheiser HD 560S?

Yes, to bring the best of these headphones an Amp is recommended. You could have a look at our collection of portable Amps here and desktop Amps here.

What is the impedance on the Sennheiser HD 560S?

The Sennheiser HD 560S comes with the impedance of 120Ω.

What do “Impedance” and “Ohms” mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω.

 Everything that I love about the Meze 99 Classics, but at a more affordable price point. Thats the 99 Neo. And I absolutely love them. Its also tuned with a more laidback and warmer sound for a more modern signature.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru 

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.
DESCRIPTION


A HEADPHONE THAT'S JUST AS SPECIAL AS YOU


The Meze 99 Neo is beautiful. Made from cast zinc alloy with a coal-black electroplated coating, it combines a contemporary black look with the best of the materials. The thickly padded memory earcups make a product that not only looks luxurious but also makes you feel special. 40MM NEODYMIUM MAGNETS FOR A RICH, BALANCED SOUND


A 40mm Neodymium magnet is placed on the side of each earcup and is designed to resonate in harmony providing a nice and wide soundstage. Rather than resorting to artificially tuned frequencies, the drivers provide dynamic contrast for a more natural listening experience.COMFORTABLE FOR LONG LISTENING SESSIONS


Meze has done exhaustive research in order to find the right material and technology for each component of the 99 Neo. To combat discomfort of any kind, the manganese spring steel headband delivers even pressure for any head size. The earcups consist of memory foam earpads and soft PU leather making these perfect for long listening sessions.
BUILT TO BE STYLISH AND DURABLE


The headphones have cast zinc alloy hardware with an electroplated coating, stamped manganese spring steel headband and internal components are made of durable ABS and silicone parts. Construction uses no glue, just nuts and bolts. The cables are made with kevlar fibres, thereby combining the best of craftsmanship and sturdiness.SERVICEABLE IN EVERY PART


The Meze 99 Neo is built to last you generations with its replaceable parts and sturdy build. Besides the usual warranty that every brand offers, the 99 Neo's parts are endlessly serviceable. Each component can be easily substituted for another. So, if any part of the headphone is damaged you can simply replace it instead of going for a new pair of headphones.

Deliver astounding accuracy with ease and grace, the DT 880 offer a wide, airy, open, spacious sound suited for production, mixing and mastering.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru 

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.
DESCRIPTION


EARMARKED AS 'THE STUDIO LEGEND'


Beyerdynamic developed The DT series in order to deliver optimal sound in a wide variety of applications and situations. They're dynamic with their headphone designs well suited for a broad range of environments.  The DT 880 PRO are ideal for mixing, editing and mastering purposes. The unaltered neutral sound, top-notch stereo imaging, and the extremely high resolution make the Beyerdynamic DT 880 PRO studio headphones a top pick studio use. With the detailed stereo imaging, they help professionals pick up on errors immediately making them ideal for mixing and mastering.ADJUSTABLE HEADBAND, VELOUR EARPADS FOR ADDED COMFORT


Soft earpads and adjustable, sliding, earpieces together with a single sided connecting cable ensure listening comfort during extended periods of use. Durability of the DT 880 Pro is unquestionable thanks to its spring steel headband. They are built to withstand the long hours at the studio and tantrums on the stage.
NATURAL SOUND AND SUPERIOR SONIC EXPERIENCE


The semi-open back design allows the studio headphones to create natural sounding music.The diaphragm has been made extremely light for better impulse performance. An extremely strong neodymium magnet system offers the DT 8800 highly detailed sound reproduction quality, and is mechanically very robust. This increased efficiency also leaves the DT 880 with greater power reserves for succinct linear response that is especially suited for high-achieving audio applications where appropriate sonic reproduction is of utmost importance, and dedicated equipment is available such as a headphone amplifier.



SEMI-OPEN, SPACIOUS AND TRANSPARENT SOUNDSTAGE


The DT 880's semi-open, over-the-ear design offers slightly increased sound isolation and reduced noise leakage, while retaining the high fidelity normally associated with open-back studio headphones. The semi open back also lets the studio headphones breathe which make the sound reproduced natural sounding and enhance it to a great extent.

FAQS

What is the warranty period on the Beyerdynamic DT 880 Pro?

The warranty period on all Beyerdynamic products is 2 years. For more warranty details click here.

How is the overall sound of Beyerdynamic DT 880 Pro?

Beyerdynamic is a German brand that has made its mark as a fine headphone manufacturer and the DT 880 Pro model gives a neutral and clear sound.

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 880 Pro come with a mic? 

No, the Beyerdynamic DT 880 Pro does not come with a mic since it is more of a studio monitoring headphone.

Is Beyerdynamic - DT 880 Pro an over the ear or on the ear product?

It is a semi open over-the-ear headphone which gives a slightly increased sound isolation and reduced noise leakage

How is the overall fit? 

Beyerdynamic DT 880 Edition comes with an adjustable headband so that it firmly and comfortably cradles your head.

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 880 Pro have detachable cables?

No,it does not have detachable cable.

Is Beyerdynamic - DT 880 Pro good for long useage?

Yes, due to it being durable, lightweight and soft earpads make music listening for long hours comfortable

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 880 Pro need an Amplifier?

Yes, since the driver units are bigger, they will need an amplifier so that the studio headphones can performance to its full potential.

Which hard case can I buy for my Beyerdynamic - DT 880 Pro? 

You can get the Beyerdynamic - DT Hard Case for your DT 880 Pro.

Why isn't there a 600-ohms version of DT 880 Pro? 

Since most headphone output in professional environments isn't designed for 600-ohms studio headphones, Beyerdynamic only offers headphones with a maximum impedance of 250-ohms.

What is the technical difference between DT 880/990 edition and DT 880/990 Pro?

The corresponding variants with the same impedance sound the same. As same transducer systems are used. The major difference is the edition models have a slightly softer headband for enjoying music at home while the Pro phones have a tighter fit onto the head for everyday work in the studio.

What is the difference between Pro and Edition models of DT 770, DT 880 and DT 990? 

The Pro series is designed for professional users and the Edition series are designed for end users. Also, the Pro and Edition series do not differ noticeably in terms of sound provided that they have the same impedance (e.g. the 250 ohm DT 880 Edition and the 250 ohms DT 880 Pro sound the same)

 I'd be lying if I said, I'm not a little biased towards Planar Magnetic headphones. HiFiMAN has managed to make great sound more accessible to the masses with the HE400se.

PRAVEEN KAMATH
Headphone Guru 



About PRAVEEN KAMATH
Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! You'll often find him listening to The Weeknd, The Score and The Script.DESCRIPTION


A BRAND-NEW PLANAR HEADPHONE FROM HIFIMAN WITH A MODERN TOUCH


Audio industry's favourite HE400 series has a new addition - the HiFiMAN HE400se. The HE400 series has been winning hearts of critics and music lovers around the world. With the HE400se, HiFiMAN gives one more reason for you to fall in love with the HE400 series. The brand-new HE400se is a dynamic planar headphone with an advanced conductive layer that covers the diaphragm reducing distortion to incredibly low levels.A THIN YET POWERFUL STEALTH MAGNET FOR DISTORTION FREE SONIC BLISS


The specially designed Stealth magnet has a unique role to play in the HE400se. Unlike traditional magnets, a stealth magnet allows soundwaves to pass without any kind of interference. The overall magnet design of the HE400se is acoustically transparent to keep the wave diffraction turbulence in check. This decrease in distortion promotes audio accuracy and enhances the audio range which ultimately leads to pure sonic bliss.
A POWERHOUSE PLANAR HEADPHONE FOR YOUR SMARTPHONE & TABLET


The planar magnetic HE400se headphone is highly sensitive making it a perfect match for audio sources with low voltage like your smartphones or your tablets. There is no need to plug in an outboard amplifier to get a pure and rich sound. The HiFiMAN HE400se is a highly proficient headphone that leaves no stone unturned to offer excellent sonic performance.ALL DAY WEARING COMFORT FOR THE PLEASURE OF MUSIC LISTENING


Music is best experienced with comfortable headphones. If you are someone who likes to listen to your music for long hours, the HiFiMAN HE400se is for you. They are not just comfortable to wear but highly durable as well. The headband of the HE400se is lightweight and adjustable which helps you to get a comfortable fit. Rest assured these headphones are cool and comfy even during extended hours of listening.
WITH DRIVER-PROTECTING CASING AND DURABLE CONNECTION OPTIONS


Drivers are the core of the HiFiMAN HE400se. That's where this planar magnetic headphone finds its strength to drive rich and clear sound. In order to make sure that these drivers are well-protected, a newly designed casing is employed. This enhances the durability of the drivers while also keeping them secure. With HE400se you get a dual-sided 3.5mm cable along with a 6.35mm adapter which allows you to connect the headphone with a host of devices.

FAQs

What is the warranty period on the HiFiMAN HE400se and how do I claim it?

All HiFiMAN products come with 1 year of warranty. To claim warranty read more on HiFiMAN warranty here. We are very helpful guys, just saying.

Does the HiFiMAN HE400se come with detachable cables?

Yes, the cables are indeed detachable. Making for easy storage and convenient for whenever you want to replace or upgrade cables.

Can I use the HiFiMAN HE400se for long listening sessions?

The HiFiMAN HE400se comes with extra soft earpads and it’s over-ear design makes them comfortable to wear for long hours.

Does the HiFiMAN HE400se come with mic?

No, the HiFiMAN HE400se does not come with a microphone.

What do “Impedance” and “Ohms” mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω.

This was my first serious headphone. I love it to death. It's got the bass to blow anyone's mind within the first few seconds of hitting play. They are also undoubtedly the best designed headphones in this segment. Absolutely unmistakable.

RAGHAV SOMANI
Headphone Guru 

About Raghav Somani
Raghav Somani is the Founder & CEO of Headphone Zone. An avid audiophile and musician since 2008, his choice of headphones include STAX Electrostats, Audeze LCD 3, and for music on the go, the JH Audio Roxanne + Astell&Kern SP1000 is never too far away. On his playlist, you'll find A.R. Rahman, Michael Jackson, and the Eagles.
DESCRIPTION



Free Custom Laser Engraving
Make your headphones truly your own. Be it a logo, your name or even a piece of artwork you've created, the state‑of‑the‑art laser engraving turns the shields on your V-MODA headphones into something others will envy.  *Once you've placed an order, please send your logo here   Read More


 A BRAINCHILD OF DJS AND MUSICIANS ALIKE


V-MODA has collaborated with musicians and DJs around the world to create a headphone with a refined and vibrant bass, lifelike vocals and crisp highs in an immersive 3D soundstage. This is done with its 50mm dual-diaphragm drivers and superior materials. With this headphone, you can experience pure audio without the artificial processing of battery-powered headsets. To ensure that these are ready for use and can consistently hit all notes, the Crossfade LP2 is tested at 6 different frequencies.FLEXIBLE. STURDY. RUGGED.


Be it a range of temperatures, salt spray, humidity or UV exposure, the Crossfade LP2 will never let you down. It is built with a steel frame and interchangeable aircraft-grade metal shields. The SteelFlex headband is so flexible, it can bend flat more than 10 times while the cable can bend over a million times. The V-MODA Crossfade LP2 is tested according to Military-Level Quality MIL-STD-810G Test Standards. You can also carry your Crossfade LP2 safely wherever you'd like. Just slip it in the Exoskeleton case & you're good to go.



ERGONOMIC FIT FOR MAXIMUM ISOLATION AND MINIMUM SOUND LEAK


More than 4 years of R&D have resulted in the ergonomic headband and hexagon-shaped earcups that does away with fatigue. The BLISS foam ear cushions take the shape of your ears for added comfort and noise isolation. Analogue sound isolation cuts out all outside noise while letting you enjoy your music without worrying about (a lot of) sound leakage.



TRUSTED BY MORE THAN 200 DJS, GRAMMY-WINNING MUSICIANS, AUDIOPHILES AND ARTISTS


V-MODA headphones are known for their blend of good looks that do not compromise on functionality. The Hex design, CliqFold, SharePlay, and V-CORK are a few of their patented or yet to be patented innovations. Each and every headphone from the Crossfade series has been created after developing over 100 prototypes and consulting more than 200 DJs, Grammy-winning musicians, audiophiles and artists.

These are amongst my all time favorites, they shine quite 'bright' on the sound quality front. Highly suited for mixing, they are one of the best studio headphones on the market at the price they retail at.

PRAVEEN KAMATH
Headphone Guru 

About PRAVEEN KAMATH
Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! You'll often find him listening to The Weeknd, The Score and The Script.
DESCRIPTION


TRUSTED BY PROFESSIONALS, A BENCHMARK FOR STUDIO SOUND


The DT 990 Pro are circumaural headphones that house extremely strong neodymium magnet systems offering highly detailed sound reproduction quality. These open-back studio headphones are a reliable tool for professionals for mixing, mastering and recording purposes. The wide stereo image and three-dimensional sound reproduction make the beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro headphones a loyal companion for producers. Outstanding tonal depth ensures that even small changes in the positioning of the acoustic source can be perceived while mixing.NATURAL BASS AND TREBLE


The open back design allows the headphones to breathe, which creates beautiful natural sounding music that you are bound to enjoy. These have a special diffuse-field design, that make these quality products apt for studio usage.The diaphragm has been made extremely light for better impulse performance. Also the high quality design only helps in better sonic experience delivering a surreal soundstage experience and natural sound.


OPEN CIRCUMAURAL DESIGN FOR DETAILING


TThe DT 990 Pro features an open-back circumaural over-the-ear design for rich audio performance that's designed for critical listening and a more natural sound stage. This increased efficiency also leaves the DT 990 Pro with greater power reserves for a succinct linear response that is especially suited for high-achieving audio applications where appropriate sonic reproduction is of paramount importance, and dedicated equipment is available such as a headphone amplifier.



ADJUSTABLE HEADBAND, VELOUR EARPADS FOR ADDED COMFORT


Beyerdynamic developed The DT series in order to deliver optimal sound in a wide variety of applications and situations.They're dynamic with their headphone designs well suited for a broad range of environments.ERGONOMIC AND DURABLE BUILD SHOWCASING 90+ YEARS OF GERMAN EXCELLENCE


The headband has been made with solid spring steel that makes these headphones durable and adds to their comfort feature since they come with two pairs of earpads: Padded faux leather and Velour. The 990 Pro's Soft earpads and adjustable, sliding, earpieces together with a single-sided connecting cable ensure listening comfort during extended periods of use.

FAQS

What is the warranty period on the Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro?

The warranty period on all Beyerdynamic products is 2 years. For more warranty details click here.

How is the overall sound of Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro?

Beyerdynamic is a German brand that has made its mark as a fine headphone manufacturer and the DT 990 Pro model gives a neutral and clear sound.

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro come with a mic? 

No, the Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro does not come with a mic since it is more of a studio monitoring headphone.

Is Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro an over the ear or on the ear product?

It is a semi open over-the-ear headphone which gives a slightly increased sound isolation and reduced noise leakage

How is the overall fit? 

Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro comes with an adjustable headband so that it firmly and comfortably cradles your head.

Does Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro have detachable cables?

No,it does not have detachable cable.

Which devices are compatible?

The DT 990 Pro is compatible with Android and iOS devices as well as studio monitoring eqiupments.

Is Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro good for long useage?

Yes, due to it being durable, lightweight and soft earpads make music listening for long hours comfortable

Does it need an Amplifier?

Yes, since the driver units are bigger, they will need an amplifier so that the headphones can performance to its full potential.

Which hard case can I buy for my Beyerdynamic - DT 990 Pro? 

You can get the Beyerdynamic - DT Hard Case for your DT 990 Pro.

Why isn't there a 600-ohms version of DT 990 Pro? 

Since most headphone output in professional environments isn't designed for 600-ohms headphones, Beyerdynamic only offers headphones with a maximum impedance of 250-ohms.

What is the technical difference between DT 880/990 edition and DT 880/990 Pro?

The Pro series is designed for professional users and the Edition series are designed for end users. Also, the Pro and Edition series do not differ noticeably in terms of sound provided that they have the same impedance (e.g. the 250 ohms DT 880 Edition and the 250 ohms DT 880 Pro sound the same).

How does the Tygr 300 R differ from the DT 880 Pro and the DT 990 Pro? 

The DT 880 PRO has a very linear frequency response, while the DT 990 PRO has a slightly more accentuated bass and accordingly more present trebles for a pleasant balance. Both are primarily designed for studio applications. The TYGR 300 R focuses on gaming. Powerful bass and detailed accentuated treble go very well with gaming. However, the sound design of the DT 990 PRO has been further optimized for gaming, sometimes through the use of a special acoustic fleece.

How can I tell what the impedance of my DT 770/880/990 Edition is?

You check the impedance of the integrated sound transducers from the connection plug. The impedance is sometimes hot-embossed onto the plastic shaft of the plug: If there is nothing there, the model has an impedance of 250 ohms. If it reads 32 Ω, the model has an impedance of 32 ohms. If it reads 600 Ω, the model has an impedance of 600 ohms.

What do "impedance" and "ohms" mean? 

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω like the T 1.

Are the DT 990 Pro Available with less headband pressure? 

No, the professional headphones are only available with the defined headband pressure. If the headband pressure is too strong for you, you can slightly try to expand the installed spring steel in the headband. For this purpose, we recommend stretching the headphones gradually for a few hours over books or similar. You should choose the width a little bit wider than the width of your head.

DESCRIPTION


THE OVERACHIEVER AMONGST ALL ITS M-SERIES SIBLING


As the most critically acclaimed model in the M-Series line, THE M50x hits the right spot when it comes to delivering a balanced sound. It seals your music in tightly with their contoured earcups, isolating all the ambient noise with no sound leakage, with minimal bleed. One of the top picks of online reviewers, top audio engineers, and cult followers agree, the M50x is an unmatched combination of audio and build-quality that gets the job done. Hour after hour, year after year.
HANDLES ANYTHING YOU THROW AT IT


The M50x produces stupendously clear, clean and most of all, accurately balanced and rich throughout the frequency spectrum making them an ideal studio headphones for listening to all types of genres. You can distinctly hear bright sounding vocals and instrumentals in one single track.



SUPERIOR SONIC PERFORMANCE BY 45MM CUSTOM TUNED DRIVERS


The drivers used in the Audio Technica ATH-M50x are 45mm large and custom made drivers with copper-coated aluminum voice coils and rare-earth magnets. M50x creates a large sense of scale that’s obviously the exact opposite of cluttered and muddy-sounding audio.



CUTTING-EDGE ENGINEERING AND ROBUST CONSTRUCTION


The M50x, even though made of plastic, is known for its use of high quality textured matte construction and overall solid durability. The Pro grade material has been used for the ear cups as well as the headband.90° SWIVELING CLOSED-BACK EARCUPS FOR ONE-EAR MONITORING


Circumaural design contours around the ears for excellent sound isolation in loud environments. 90° rotating ear cups ensure you can do some critical listening, one ear at a time.



STRAIGHT AND COILED SINGLE SIDED CABLE OPTIONS TO CHOOSE FROM


The M50x includes three cable options: 1.2m - 3.0m coiled cable, 1.2m straight and 3.0 m straight cable. The 3m straight single-side cable is designed to make these studio headphones convenient for studio tracking, mixing and field recording. They are very convenient in terms of usage and make life simple. Making them the top choice for studio tracking and mixing, as well as DJ monitoring and personal listening.

FAQs

What is the warranty period on Audio-Technica ATH-M50x and how do I claim warranty?

The warranty period is 3 Years from the date of invoice for all M-Series and E-Series (Pro Products). In order to claim warranty, please visit our Audio-Technica warranty page. We are very helpful guys, just saying.

The sound signature of the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x is?

Very flat. Essentially made for professional studio monitoring, you can expect a neutral sound from the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x. Bassheads, leave now before you set yourself up for disappointment.

Is the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x ideal for DJs?

No, they are not. You can have a look at the V-MODA Crossfade LP2 as it is ideal for DJ and live shows.

Does the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x come with an open-back design?

No, it doesn’t. If you are looking for a wide soundstage our top recommendation will be the Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro. It features an open-back design with much more detailing as compared to the ATH-M50x.

Will Audio-Technica ATH-M50x require an Amp?

Although your smartphone and laptop will be able to drive it, an amplifier would certainly bring out the true potential of the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x. Read more about amplification and why it's important here.

What is the difference between the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x and the Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro?

The Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro will have a flatter response, as accurate to the source as possible. The Audio-Technica ATH-M50x will have relatively extended low end in comparison.

Does detachable cable mean I can use it without the wire as well?

No, they can’t. Detachable cables mean they can be replaced when they go south!

Are Audio-Technica ATH-M50x built to last? Could I use it when travelling?

Yes, they are durable and are travel friendly since they fold and a travel carry pouch is also included with the product.

Could I change the parts if they wear out?

Yes, we provide high quality replacement parts for the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x. You can replace the headband and the earpads from Headphone Zone directly.

How many cables does the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x come with?

The product comes with 3 cables: 3.9 to 9.8' (1.2 to 3 m) Coiled Cable, 9.8' (3 m) Straight Cable and 3.9' (1.2 m) Straight Cable. Who doesn't like options?

What devices is the Audio-Technica ATH-M50x compatible with?

These headphones are mostly used by studio professionals and come with a 6.3mm adaptor for use with consoles. You can also use the 3.5mm jack with your laptop or smartphone.

Is Audio-Technica ATH-M50x an ideal product for everyday casual use?

Ideally no. Because these require a dedicated amp for the best quality and because they're quite flat sounding, we wouldn't recommend these to casual music listeners.

How do Audio-Technica ATH-M50x stack up against Ultrasone Performance 820?

Both these headphones are flagship products under the 10k range having their strenghts and usability. To help understand better we have an easy to understand blog comparing the Audio Technica M50x vs Ultrasone Performance 820 here.

The old guard of studio headphones, DT 770 PRO has a sound that stands the test of time making it a worthy consideration for home and studio use. Albeit the old school design, it has very good comfort, supreme isolation and a clean sound quality.

PRAVEEN KAMATH
Headphone Guru 

About PRAVEEN KAMATH
Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! You'll often find him listening to The Weeknd, The Score and The Script.
DESCRIPTION


SETTING THE BENCHMARK FOR STUDIO HEADPHONES


The Beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO is built as an ideal studio monitoring headphone suitable for the most demanding professional and audiophile applications such as for recording studios, post-production or broadcasting situations.LOVED BY PRODUCERS, MIXING ENGINEERS, SOUND ENGINEERS AND AUDIOPHILES ALIKE


Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro studio headphones have set an industry benchmark for reference audio sound and accurate sound reproduction. They are loved by music enthusiasts, music producers, sound engineers and broadcasters all over the world. These studio headphones are used in all the studios and have a great response towards the entire frequency range. It also delivers punchy detail in low frequency music.
YOUR STUDIO ON THE GO


DT770 Pro would never let you compromise with the studio sound you prefer to listen to, you can just hold them up and take them where you want.



CHOOSE THE RIGHT VARIANT FOR YOU


 32Ω - The highly optimized 32 ohms variant is used for regular casual listening over laptops and smartphones. 80Ω - The 80 ohms is a wide choice for a range of studio applications. It is the most commonly used variant.  250Ω - The 250 ohms are more suitable for mixing and recording in the studios with audio interfaces and mixing desks.



EXCELLENT IMPULSE RESPONSE WITH A CLEAN SOUND


These studio headphones deliver a top-notch impulse response and exceptional isolation in a perfectly neutral listening environment. The high frequencies have detailed and differentiated sounds whereas the ultra-low bass sounds are defined and crispy.



SUPREME COMFORT WITH SUPERIOR VELOUR EARPADS


 The DT 770 PRO comes with velour earpads while the 32 Ohm Limited Edition variant comes with leatherette earpads which is meant for long hours of wearing. The inner headband softly sits on the head and the nominal pressure of the headband is approx. 3.5 N which in simple terms means it gives adequate comfort.

FAQs

What is the warranty period on the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro?

The warranty period on all Beyerdynamic products is 2 years. For more warranty details click here.

How is the overall sound of Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro?

Beyerdynamic is a German brand that has made its mark as a fine headphone manufacturer and the DT 770 Pro model comes with a bass heavy and a clean powerful sound.

Are the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro ideal for DJs?

No, they are not. You can have a look at the V-MODA Crossfade LP2 as it is ideal for DJ and live shows.

Is the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro open-back?

No, it does not come with open-back design. If you are looking for a wide soundstage our top recommendation will be the Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro. It features an open-back design with much more detailing as compared to the DT 770 PRO.

Does Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro come with a mic? 

No, the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro does not come with a mic since it is more of a studio monitoring headphone.

Is Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro an over the ear or on the ear product?

It is a closed-back over-the-ear headphone which makes listening to music even better thanks to its natural noise isolation.

How is the overall fit? 

Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro fits on the ear so don't go expecting the earcups to envelop your ears in lush comfort.

Does Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro have detachable cables?

No, Unfortunately it does not come with a detachable cable feature.

Do you need an Amplifier for 80 Ohms or 250 Ohms?

Yes, since the driver units are bigger, they will need an amplifier so that the headphones can performance to its full potential.

How do these stack up against Ultrasone Performance 820?

Apart from both these headphones being able to be driven easily by your smartphones it is also a choice between a warm and smooth sound against a balanced sound. Read more comparison between the two headphones here

Will the DT 1770 Pro replace the DT 770 Pro?

No, the DT 1770 Pro is an upgraded version of the DT 770 PRO, made for audio engineers, producers, and musicians who need a pair of high-end studio headphones without compromising on performance in all the aspects such as sound, design, comfort, and accessories. The DT 770 Pro is for beginners who want a reliable, robust, and affordable pair of headphones to work with.

What is the difference between Pro and edition models of DT 770, DT 880, and DT 990? 

The Pro series is designed for professional users and the Edition series are designed for end users. Also, the Pro and Edition series do not differ noticeably in terms of sound provided that they have the same impedance (e.g. the 250 ohms DT 880 Edition and the 250 ohms DT 880 Pro sound the same).

Which hard case can I buy for my DT 770 Pro? 

You can get the Beyerdynamic - DT Hard Case for your DT 770 Pro.

Why isn't there a 600-ohms version of the DT 770 Pro models? 

In professional environments most headphone outputs aren't designed for 600-ohms headphones, we only offer headphones with a maximum impedance of 250-ohms.

Why does my DT 770/990 Pro have another connection cable with a smaller thread? 

In order to be able to plug the headphones with the 3.5 mm jack (unscrewed jack adapter) into a mobile device with a bumper, the M8 thread, which was previously available, was converted to a smaller M5 thread. If your headphones have such an M5 thread you will need an adapter. If you own an M8 threaded jack adapter you can still use it for your headphones, but only as a plug adapter.

What's the difference between the DT770/990 Pro and the DT 1770/1990 Pro? 

The DT 770/990 Pro is made for beginners musicians, sound engineers, producers who are looking for a reliable, sturdy, and affordable pair of headphones as a working device. The DT 1770/1990 Pro was developed for sound engineers, producers, and musicians looking for a pair of high-end studio headphones with uncompromising performance in all relevant aspects such as sound, design, comfort, and accessories.

What is the warranty period on Shure and how do I claim Warranty?

How comfortable is the Shure - SRH240A?

Are the Shure - SRH240A good for casual use?

The Shure SRH240A is an high-quality professional headphones you can be relaxing at your home or commuting to work while still enjoying your favourite music in high quality audio.

Can the earpads be replaced?

Yes, they can be removed and cleant so you have a clean and comfortable headset everyday.

Will I be happy with how these sound?

If you like to listen to all kinds of genres, the Shure SRH240A is the best pick for you as it delivers rich bass, clear mid and highs frequencies so that you get a comprehensive music listening experience. Shure SRH240A is designed to offer comfort even during extended music listening sessions.

How to decide on the best headphone?

We know that choosing a headphone is something that is a tough choice and so we have written an article on  best headphones under 7000 which you can read here.

Does the Shure - SRH240A come with a Mic? 

No,the Shure SRH240A does not include a mic. Kind of a bummer, ain't it?

How does the Shure - SRH240A overall sound?

The closed-back, circumaural design of the SRH240A helps to cut out ambient noise and adds extra power to the bass response, giving you a full bodied audio experience.

What do “Impedance” and “Ohms” mean?

Impedance is the so-called alternating-current resistance that headphones have under specific standard conditions. On devices with low output impedance, headphones are the louder, the lower their impedance is. In principle, we recommend that you choose headphones with low impedance for use on devices that are operated by battery/rechargeable battery (i.e. most portable devices such as smartphones, tablet computers but also notebooks). You can distinguish between high and low impedance. Usually, the gradations 18 Ω, 32 Ω, and 80 Ω are used in the low range. In the high range, 250 Ω are common. If you want to get the most out of your system (and it has the power to do so), choose a model with 600 Ω.

Does the Shure - SRH240A need and amp?

Yes, since it has a high impedence which cannot be driven by a smartphone an Amp gives it the extra boost to the sound.

DESCRIPTION


PURE. PROFESSIONAL. PERFORMANCE.


The M-Series ATH-M40x professional monitor headphones are tuned flat for incredibly accurate audio monitoring across an extended frequency range. Now enhance your studio experience with superior sound isolation and swiveling earcups for convenient one-ear monitoring.
40MM DRIVERS WITH RARE EARTH MAGNETS AND COPPER-CLAD ALUMINIUM WIRE VOICE COILS


The drivers used in the ATH-M40x are 40mm large and custom made drivers with copper-coated aluminum voice coils and rare-earth magnets. They're fine tuned to deliver a superior sonic experience!



HITS THAT SWEET SPOT FOR BASS


The M40x is tuned flat for incredibly accurate sound monitoring across the entire frequency range spectrum to produce stupendously clear, clean and most of all, balanced. You can distinctly hear bright sounding vocals and instrumentals in a single track - which creates a large sense of scale that’s obviously the exact opposite of cluttered and muddy-sounding audio. CUTTING-EDGE ENGINEERING AND ROBUST CONSTRUCTION


 The M40x, even though made of plastic, is known for its use of high quality textured matte construction and overall solid durability. The Pro grade material has been used for the ear cups as well as the headband.



90° SWIVELING CLOSED-BACK EARCUPS FOR ONE-EAR MONITORING


 The cups literally contour your ears and place them inside an air-tight enclosure that feels plush and comfortable. There is no pressure being placed against your ears as a roomy interior is provided. Circumaural design contours around the ears for excellent sound isolation in loud environments.
STRAIGHT AND COILED SINGLE SIDED CABLE OPTIONS


 The M40x includes two cable options: 1.2 m - 3.0 m coiled cable and 3.0 m straight cable. The 3m straight single-side cable is designed to make the headphones convenient for studio tracking, mixing and field recording. They are very convenient in terms of usage and make life simple.

What is the warranty period on Audio Technica ATH M40x and how do I claim warranty?

The warranty period is 3 Years from the date of invoice for all M-Series and E-Series (Pro Products). In order to claim a warranty, visit our Audio-Technica warranty page. We are very helpful guys, just saying.

For who is the Audio Technica ATH-M40x best suited for? 

The Audio Technica ATH-M40x is best suited for those who want professional studio tracking and mixing as well as DJ monitoring.

Are the Audio-Technica - ATH-M40x foldable?

Yes, the ATH-M40x has been meticulously engineered for comfort, convenience, and portability.

Does the Audio-Technica - ATH-M40x come with carry case?

Yes, the Audio-Technica - ATH-M40x does comes with a carry case in the box.

Do I really need an amp though?

We have an article that should help understand why an Amp is important. Read about it here.

What are the cables provided with the ATH-M40x? 

The ATH-M40x comes with two cables, a 1.2m-3.0m useful for DJs and the other a 3.0m useful for studio monitoring.

For mixing, which is better, open or closed back headphones?

A closed back headphone is ideally a good choice since it contains the sound within the earpads since they are also over the ear. To understand how they are different from open back read Difference between open back and closed back headphone.

How do the Audio-Technica - ATH-M40x stack up against Ultrasone HFI-450?

Both have their pros and we have actually written a dedicated buying guide to help you understand better. Read it here.

How durable are the Audio-Technica - ATH-M40x?

Since they are made of plastic the headphones are simply acceptable in terms of durability.

Are the Audio-Technica - ATH-M40x good for starting DJs?

Yes, ideally these headphones could work well for the beginner DJ.

headPhone.product_description:
Designed in  Japan

DESCRIPTION


SOUND AS FLAT AS A PANCAKE


The ATH-M30x is tuned flat for incredibly accurate sound monitoring across the entire frequency range spectrum to produce stupendously clear, clean and most of all, reference sound. You can distinctly hear bright sounding vocals and instrumentals in a single track.
40MM FINE-TUNED DRIVERS FOR SUPERIOR SONIC EXPERIENCE


The drivers used in the Audio Technica - ATH-M30x are 40mm large and custom made drivers with copper-coated aluminum voice coils and rare-earth magnets. You can distinctly hear bright sounding vocals and instrumentals in a single track.



DURABLE HARD PLASTIC CONSTRUCTION


The M30x, even though made of plastic, is known for its use of high quality textured matte construction and overall solid durability. The Pro grade material has been used for the ear cups as well as the headband.
CLOSED-BACK CUPS FOR SUPERIOR ISOLATION


 The cups literally contour your ears and place them inside an air-tight enclosure that feels plush and comfortable. There is no pressure being placed against your ears as a roomy interior is provided.
SINGLE SIDED CABLE


 The 3m straight single-side cable is designed to make the headphones convenient for studio tracking, mixing and field recording. They are very convenient in terms of usage and make life simple.

headPhone.product_description:
Designed in  Germany

Best Suited forPortable Use

Works withAndroid & iOS

DESCRIPTION


MEET SENNHEISER'S HD 569 SEMI OPEN-BACK HOME ENTERTAINMENT HEADPHONE


Sennheiser introduces a successor to its HD 500 series lineup of headphones, the HD 569. The HD 569 are a semi open-back headphone designed for those needing outstanding sound quality. Powered by proprietary transducer technology and featuring 'Ergonomic Acoustic Refinement (E.A.R) design, the HD 569 drives toward audiophile reproduction. Featuring a semi open-back design, the HD 569 delivers natural tonal balance, and exceptional wearing comfort is provided by large ear cups fitted with plush velour ear cushions.
ENGINEERED WITH PREMIUM COMPONENTS TO DELIVER AUDIOPHILE-GRADE SOUND


The team of acoustic engineers at Sennheiser have designed the HD 569 to offer pristine audio reproduction. The Sennheiser HD 569 pushes performance to the next level and features premium components in its making. Embedded with a proprietary transducer system that delivers rich detail and deep bass response. Sennheiser engineered these transducers using aluminium voice coils for high efficiency, excellent dynamics and extremely low distortion. These transducers work in harmony with the Ergonomic Acoustic Refinement (E.A.R) design that channels audio directly into your ears producing a more 'in the room' like listening experience.OFFERS NOISE ISOLATION WITH ITS AROUND THE EAR AND SEMI OPEN-BACK DESIGN


The Sennheiser HD 569 have been carefully designed to offer you a comfortable and ergonomic fit. With its over-ear design, the HD 569 offers exceptional wearing comfort for the longest of listening sessions. Thanks to its large ear cups and a semi open-back design, the HD 569 effectively reduces ambient noise improving your listening experience and letting you immerse in your music. This isolation and comfort are further elevated by the luxurious velour covered ear cushions and padded headband allowing for a longer listening session without fatigue.


COMES BUNDLED WITH TWO DETACHABLE CABLES AND OFFERS CALLING FUNCTIONALITY


The Sennheiser HD 569 semi open-back headphones come with detachable cables allowing for easy storage and even offering a chance to upgrade. This detachable cable design is usually found in higher-end headphones and is very helpful in various use cases. To get you started, Sennheiser ships the HD 569 with two high-quality detachable cables and a 3.5mm plug and a 6.3mm plug for connecting the headphones to various devices. The included 1.2 m cables come with a 1-button remote and microphone embedded to allow you to use the HD 569 for communication purposes. With an impedance of 23 ohms, the HD 569 can be connected to your phones and be used to make or receive calls. This is thoughtful and makes the HD 569 the perfect headphones for an audiophile experience and leisure.

headPhone.product_description:
Designed & Made in Germany
Flat Sound Signature
2 Years ofWarranty

45mm DynamicDrivers


The old guard of studio headphones, DT 770 PRO has a sound that stands the test of time making it a worthy consideration for home and studio use. Albeit the old school design, it has very good comfort, supreme isolation and a clean sound quality.

PRAVEEN KAMATH
Headphone Guru 

About PRAVEEN KAMATH
Praveen, our Headphone Zone is an audio connoisseur and staunch Meze fanboy. He loves the RAI Penta and the Empyrean, equally. When not writing about, thinking about or listening to music: He's an avid beerologist too and staunchly believes that the combination of both beats every music setup out there! You'll often find him listening to The Weeknd, The Score and The Script.
DESCRIPTION


SETTING THE BENCHMARK FOR STUDIO HEADPHONES


The Beyerdynamic DT 770 PRO is built as an ideal studio monitoring headphone suitable for the most demanding professional and audiophile applications such as for recording studios, post-production or broadcasting situations.LOVED BY PRODUCERS, MIXING ENGINEERS, SOUND ENGINEERS AND AUDIOPHILES ALIKE


Beyerdynamic DT770 Pro studio headphones have set an industry benchmark for reference audio sound and accurate sound reproduction. They are loved by music enthusiasts, music producers, sound engineers and broadcasters all over the world. These studio headphones are used in all the studios and have a great response towards the entire frequency range. It also delivers punchy detail in low frequency music.
YOUR STUDIO ON THE GO


DT770 Pro would never let you compromise with the studio sound you prefer to listen to, you can just hold them up and take them where you want.



CHOOSE THE RIGHT VARIANT FOR YOU


 32Ω - The highly optimized 32 ohms variant is used for regular casual listening over laptops and smartphones. 80Ω - The 80 ohms is a wide choice for a range of studio applications. It is the most commonly used variant.  250Ω - The 250 ohms are more suitable for mixing and recording in the studios with audio interfaces and mixing desks.



EXCELLENT IMPULSE RESPONSE WITH A CLEAN SOUND


These studio headphones deliver a top-notch impulse response and exceptional isolation in a perfectly neutral listening environment. The high frequencies have detailed and differentiated sounds whereas the ultra-low bass sounds are defined and crispy.



SUPREME COMFORT WITH SUPERIOR VELOUR EARPADS


 The DT 770 PRO comes with velour earpads while the 32 Ohm Limited Edition variant comes with leatherette earpads which is meant for long hours of wearing. The inner headband softly sits on the head and the nominal pressure of the headband is approx. 3.5 N which in simple terms means it gives adequate comfort.
